channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-2299] Isartor tests don't work anymore
item.description:
Sorry, I hadn't thought about this when testing the no-awt version, but the Isartor tests don't work anymore (I have them enabled for my own version since PDFBOX-2179).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.TestIsartor
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 204, Failures: 35, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 29.485 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.TestIsartor
validate[target\pdfs\Isartor testsuite\PDFA-1b\6.2 Graphics\6.2.3 Colour spaces\6.2.3.3 Uncalibrated colour spaces\isartor-6-2-3-3-t02-fail-h.pdf](org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.TestIsartor)  Time elapsed: 0.092 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: isartor-6-2-3-3-t02-fail-h.pdf : IllegalArgumentException raised , message=Built-in Encoding required for symbolic font
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.TestIsartor.validate(TestIsartor.java:175)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Oh, I meant to enable these tests by default. I guess I'll have to fix them first...

Also for me, the regressions since may 23, 2014 are significant

PDFBOX-2348 , PDFBOX-2349, etc.

Quite some users in Switzerland appear to be ready for such Pdf/A validations, but the preflight should reliably judge on the reference pdf's and be equivalent to other validators:

See http://kost-ceco.ch/cms/index.php?id=248,434,0,0,1,0
hauser@acm.org, we're happy to take contributions from Swiss developers
You closed PDFBOX-2348 - there was a patch to at least fix one of the NullPointers

That's ok, I know where to find it.

P.S. You can attach files with "More > Attach Files".
The mentioned patch from PDFBOX-2348 attached as file.

I added the initialisation of the member variable font in [ https://svn.apache.org/r1629439 ]. However there's a second SimpleFontValidator constructor that doesn't have a font parameter. This second constructor is called only by DescendantFontValidator, which has a PDCIDFont, which is not a PDSimpleFont.

Anyway, before there were 35 failures, now there are "only" 13.

Commit 1629444 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629444 ]

PDFBOX-2299: initialize member variable, as suggested by Ralf Hauser

hauser@acm.org I committed your patch, while I believe it is correct and needed, it neither fixes the issue, nor does it fix the processing of the file from PDFBOX-2348. The reason is that later in Type0Validator (createCIDType0FontValidator), the descendent font is processed - see my earlier comment.

Thanks a lot. I could work on that constructor etc., but as a newbie to the code, perhaps John is a lot better positioned to eradicate the last 13 failures?

Or if he still doesn't have this regression on his priority list - what is the last revision where it didn't fail?

It happened with the "no-awt" change, which was a major one. We can't revert this.

Re priority list, I can't look into Johns mind, I don't know if he has a priority list. I certainly wish that regressions be very high on it. However, like all of us, he also has paid work.

The cause of the NPEs is that previously, PDCIDFontType0 was extended from PDSimpleFont, and now no more (there's a comment "a CIDFont is not actually a font"). But DescendantFontValidator is extended from SimpleFontValidator and this doesn't work because a constructor is used that doesn't store the font.

Using the base class PDFontLike instead of PDSimpleFont gets rid of all the NPE and the error count is down to 4:

TestIsartor.validate:175 isartor-6-2-3-3-t02-fail-h.pdf : IllegalArgumentException raised , message=Built-in Encoding required for symbolic font
TestIsartor.validate:175 isartor-6-2-3-3-t02-fail-i.pdf : IllegalArgumentException raised , message=Built-in Encoding required for symbolic font
TestIsartor.validate:175 isartor-6-3-4-t01-fail-g.pdf : IllegalArgumentException raised , message=Built-in Encoding required for symbolic font
TestIsartor.validate:169 isartor-6-3-5-t01-fail-a.pdf : Invalid error code returned. expected:<3.[3.1]> but was:<3.[1.6]>

The good thing with preflight is that the change rate there is very low, i.e. even if John doesn't like my fix, reverting all won't remove any other changes.

I've also a solution for "Built-in Encoding required for symbolic font" so the error count will be down to 1. (Still too much)

Commit 1629707 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629707 ]

PDFBOX-2299: use PDFontLike instead of PDSimpleFont because PDCIDFontType0 is not extended from PDSimpleFont

Commit 1629711 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629711 ]

PDFBOX-2299: revert to use default encoding if base encoding is missing, as seen in Isartor test files with Type3 fonts

The next three errors deal with the exception "Built-in Encoding required for symbolic font". This is thrown by DictionaryEncoding constructor with type 3 fonts used in the Isartor test files. I don't have to investigate this too much, instead I just revert to what was done in the pre-no-awt version: assign a default encoding.

Commit 1629713 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629713 ]

PDFBOX-2299: fix typo

There's one error left:
validate[target\pdfs\Isartor testsuite\PDFA-1b\6.3 Fonts\6.3.5 Font subsets\isartor-6-3-5-t01-fail-a.pdf](org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.TestIsartor) Time elapsed: 0.034 sec <<< FAILURE!
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: isartor-6-3-5-t01-fail-a.pdf : Invalid error code returned. expected:<3.[3.1]> but was:<3.[1.6]>

So it is reporting a different error than the expecting error. When checking the file, I get this:

The fileisartor-6-3-5-t01-fail-a.pdf is not valid, error(s) : 3.1.6 : Invalid Font definition, Width of the character "53" in the font program
"RWBPLJ+AdobeMingStd-Light-Identity-H"is inconsistent with the width in the PDF dictionary.

The font is a type0 font. Apparently, something was lost in refactoring in CIDType0Container.getFontProgramWidth(). There's a comment "// fixme: this does not take into account the PDF's CMap or the FontDescriptor's default width".

Many many thanks Tilman!
Maybe PDFBOX-2403 allows to isolate the problem of your last error left?

Commit 1629936 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629936 ]

PDFBOX-2299: remove unneeded init, fix javadoc

Commit 1629937 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629937 ]

PDFBOX-2299: fix javadoc

Commit 1629939 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629939 ]

PDFBOX-2299: code + javadoc cleanup

Commit 1629956 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629956 ]

PDFBOX-2299, PDFBOX-2403: more error details, as suggested by Ralf Hauser; minor code + javadoc cleanup

Commit 1629958 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629958 ]

PDFBOX-2299, PDFBOX-2403: more error details, as suggested by Ralf Hauser

Maybe PDFBOX-2403 allows to isolate the problem of your last error left?

Sadly not.

Commit 1630213 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1630213 ]

PDFBOX-2299: fix typo

Commit 1630283 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1630283 ]

PDFBOX-2299: FDSelect uses GIDs, not CIDs

The previous commit fixes the error:

isartor-6-3-5-t01-fail-a.pdf : Invalid error code returned. expected:<3.[3.1]> but was:<3.[1.6]>

Which was caused by an underlying bug in CFFCIDFont when handling (relatively rare) CID fonts which use FDSelect.

Commit 1630284 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1630284 ]

PDFBOX-2299: Update preflight to use 2.0 font handing

  • Removes preflight legacy Type1Parser and associated classes, uses Type 1 parser from FontBox 2.0
  • Replaces FontContainer#getFontProgramWidth() with PDFont#getWidthFromFont()
  • Removes most of the functionality of FontContainer subclasses, as PDFont and its various subclasses now handle these checks
  • Added PDFont#isDamaged() to gain access to PDFBox font parsing status
    -Removed preflight FontLike and replaced with PDFontLike from 2.0

Preflight has accumulated a lot of legacy code as the font handling in PDFBox core has improved. The last commit finally removes the redundancy from Preflight and handing the responsibilities of font parsing over to PDFBox. I've added an isDamaged() method to PDFont so that Preflight can tell the difference between a damaged font (once whose parsing results in an IOException) vs. a missing embedded font, as PDFont currently abstracted over this.

Preflight also had its own Type 1 parser, which I've removed and replaced with our new one in FontBox.

PDFBOX-2299: Clean up Isartor tests and enable by default
The Isartor tests are now enabled by default when doing a "mvn install". I made some performance improvements so that TestIsartor only adds around 7 seconds to the build time (on my machine).
